modName: The Milk Drinker's Guide To Modding Skyrim
summary: A guide for modding Skyrim.  Work in Progress.
descriptionHtml:
[center][u][font=Trebuchet MS][i][b]
[color=#f1c232][size=6]The Milk Drinker's Guide to Modding Skyrim[/size][/color][/b][/i][/font][/u][/center][size=3][color=#e69138]
New to modding Skyrim?[/color]  Want to install all those great looking mods you see, but don't know how? Or maybe you've tried installing a few only to have Skyrim crash every 5 minutes?  Follow this guide's step-by-step process for a complete Skyrim overhaul.

This is my attempt at a complete A-Z walk-through for modding Skyrim.  Take your Skyrim from vanilla to a heavily modded piece of art, while staying within the lore and keeping gameplay close to traditional, all while keeping Skyrim as stable as possible.

[color=#e69138]My goal is to make this guide as thorough as possible, while keeping things simple.[/color] 95% of this guide will be downloading and installing mods through NMM. The other 5% will be a small amount of copying and pasting files into your Skyrim folder. Start at step one and work your way down the list.
[/size][center]
[b][color=#f1c232][size=2]Required Tools:[/size][/color][/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/?]Nexus Mod Manager[/url]
[url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/?]WryeBash[/url]

[b][color=#f1c232][size=2][/size][/color][/b][b][color=#f1c232][size=2]Recommended System Specs:[/size][/color][/b]
Quad-core CPU
8GB RAM or better
2GB 760 GTX or better
SSD Drive[/center]

[color=#e69138]Small disclaimer:[/color]
This guide completely overhauls vanilla Skyrim with over 200+ mods that will use 10+ GB of space.  [color=#f1c232]It's a lengthy process and will take [i]at least[/i] 3-4 hours to complete[/color].  While I try to keep this simple for newcomers to modding Skyrim, a small amount of technical aptitude is required.  Mods get updated frequently, and it's possible some errors and conflicts exist within this guide.

[color=#f1c232][u][b][color=#f1c232][size=6]STEP 1 - START WITH A CLEAN INSTALL
[/size][/color][/b][/u][/color][color=#e69138]You must start with a completely vanilla version of Skyrim in order to follow this guide.  [/color]

[color=#f1c232]If you had any previous mods installed:[/color]
[list=1][*][size=2]In Steam, unsubscribe from all Steam Workshop mods.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]In Nexus Mod Manager, uninstall all active mods.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Open your Steam library, right click on "[color=#f1c232]The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim[/color]" and choose "[color=#f1c232]Delete Local Content...[/color]"
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Use Windows Explorer to delete your [b][color=#f1c232]main Skyrim folder[/color] [/b]in Steam [u][color=#99FFFF](X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim)[/color][/u]
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Delete your [b][color=#f1c232]Skyrim folder[/color] located in "My Games"[/b] [u][color=#99FFFF](C:\My Documents\My Games\Skyrim)[/color][/u]
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Delete your [b][color=#f1c232]Skyrim folder[/color][/b] located in "AppData" [u][color=#99FFFF](C:\Users\yourusername\AppData\Local\Skyrim)[/color][/u]
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Re-install Skyrim through Steam.[/size]
[/*]
[/list]
[b][color=#f1c232]Run SkyrimLauncher.exe[/color][/b]
After Steam finishes downloading, run [color=#f1c232]SkyrimLauncher.exe[/color].  You don't need to start the actual game, simply running the launcher will create the necessary system files needed for programs like Nexus Mod Manager.

[b][color=#f1c232][u][color=#f1c232][size=6]STEP 2 - Manual Modding
[/size][/color][/u][/color][/b][color=#e69138]I tried to keep everything NMM based for easy installation.  Unfortunately, there's a few things you'll have to manually install using Windows Explorer.[/color]

[size=4][b][color=#f1c232]The Skyrim folder and Skyrim\Data folder
[/color][/b][/size]I'll be referring to two different folder quite often in this section - the main [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder, and the Skyrim\[color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder.  It's important to know the difference between your main [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder and your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder for the following steps.  

Whenever you see [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] or [color=#e69138]Data[/color] in orange text, I'm referring to their directory locations. 
The [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder is usually located at [color=#99FFFF][u]X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim[/u] [/color]and contains [color=#f1c232]TESV.exe[/color] and [color=#f1c232]SkyrimLauncher.exe[/color].  
The [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder is usully located at [u][color=#00ffff]X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim\data [/color][/u]and contains files like [color=#f1c232]HighResTexturePack01.bsa[/color] and [color=#f1c232]HighResTexturePack.esp[/color].  

Make sure you have the latest version of [url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8109]DirectX9[/url].

[b][color=#f1c232][u][size=4]Install SKSE[/size][/u] [/color](Current Version 1.7.1)[/b]
Download [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]SKSE (Skyrim Script Extender)[/url] and install it to your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] directory.  The .exe file allows for easy installation and should automatically detect your Skyrim directory.

[color=#f1c232][b][u][size=4]Install SSME[/size][/u]
[/b][/color]Download [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50305/?]Skyrim Startup Memory Editor - SSME[/url].  Extract and copy the two files ([color=#f1c232]d3dx9_42.dll[/color] and [color=#f1c232]ssme.ini[/color]) to your main [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] directory.

[b][color=#f1c232][u][size=4]ENB Profile[/size][/u]
[/color][/b]For this guide, we'll be using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20781/?]Project ENB[/url].  The author (bronze316) provides some very handy drag-and-drop profile settings to which makes tweaking your ENB especially easy.

[color=#f1c232]Installing the [/color][color=#e69138]Project ENB[/color][color=#f1c232] profile: [/color](based on my preferences - also assuming you have a decent PC) 
[list=1][*][size=2]Manually download [color=#f1c232]Project ENB v0_221 - Complete - CoT v3_1 [/color]from the Project ENB downloads section.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Extract the files and open the folder.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Choose which profile you'd like to use for Project ENB.  The options are Fantasy, Realistic, Cinematic, and Cinematic Winter.  I recommend using the [color=#f1c232]Cinematic[/color] profile.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Open the profile's folder, then open the[color=#f1c232] [/color][color=#e69138]main files[/color] folder for that profile.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Copy [color=#f1c232]everything[/color] (2 folders and 19 loose files) from the [color=#e69138]main files[/color] folder to your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder. 
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Navigate to the [color=#e69138]optional effects[/color] folder for the profile you chose for Project ENB.  This folder is located in the same directory as the [color=#e69138]main files[/color][color=#f1c232] [/color]folder.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Open the [color=#e69138]BlurSharp Only[/color] folder in optional effects and copy [color=#f1c232]effect.txt[/color] to your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Navigate to the [color=#e69138]performance options[/color] folder for the profile you chose.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Select a performance profile to match your computer's performance.  For this guide, we'll be using [color=#f1c232]Option A (SSAO-SSIL + DOF)[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Open the [color=#e69138]Option A[/color] folder and copy [color=#f1c232]enbseries.ini[/color] to your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]In your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder find and open [color=#f1c232]enblocal.ini [/color]in Notepad.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Find [color=#f1c232]VideoMemorySizeMb=1024 [/color](which should be the default)[color=#f1c232] [/color]and set it to [color=#f1c232]VideoMemorySizeMb=4096[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Find [color=#f1c232]EnableCompression[/color] and [color=#f1c232]AutoDetectVideoMemorySize[/color] and change them both to [color=#f1c232]false[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Save [color=#f1c232]enblocal.ini[/color] and close Notepad.[/size][/*]
[/list][color=#f1c232][b][u][size=4]
ENB Core Files[/size][/u]
[/b][/color]Download the latest ENBSeries file at [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htm]http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htm[/url].

Extract the file (enbseries_skyrim_v0xxx.zip) and open the [color=#e69138]WrapperVersion[/color][color=#f1c232] [/color]folder.  Copy/paste [color=#f1c232]d3d9.dll [/color]and [color=#f1c232]enbhost.exe [/color]from the WrapperVesion folder to your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] directory.

[color=#f1c232][size=4][u][b].INI Files[/b][/u][/size][/color]
[list=1][*][size=2]Run [color=#f1c232]SkyrimLauncher.exe[/color] in your [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder.  Your video settings should be re-detected after the ENB installation (although it might not notify you that it did).
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Download the Skyrim.ini files listed in the download section.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Copy/paste the two files included ([color=#f1c232]Skyrim.ini[/color], [color=#f1c232]Skyrimprefs.ini[/color]) to [u][color=#00ffff]My Documents\My Games\Skyrim[/color][/u].  Allow these files to overwrite the existing ones.[/size][/*]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][*][color=#f1c232][size=4][u][b]Test It[/b][/u][/size][/color][/*]
[*][size=2]Run Skyrim via SKSE.  This can be done from the desktop shortcut placed on your desktop [color=#f1c232]Skyrim (SKSE)[/color] or by running [color=#f1c232]skse_loader.exe[/color] in your main Skyrim directory.
[/size][/*]
[*][color=#f1c232][size=2][u][b]
[/b][/u][/size][/color][/*]
[*][size=2]If installed correctly, you should see the ENB display the following text in the [color=#f1c232]top-left corner[/color] of your screen on the main menu when starting Skyrim (except QUOTE):[/size][/*]
[quote]ENBSeries 0.261
visit site for updates, user configs
and other modifications:
http://enbdev.com
Copyright (c) 2007-2014 Boris Voronstov


current videoadapter: <<whatever you're using>>[/quote][*][b][color=#f1c232][size=4][u]Other[/u][/size][/color][/b][/*]
[size=2]Download the following files, extract their contents and using Windows Explorer copy/paste the contents into your Skyrim [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder.

-[url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=6&t=1499]Skyrim Particle All-In-One Patch
[/url]Copy the [color=#e69138]meshes[/color] and [color=#e69138]textures[/color] folders into your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder.

-[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14884/?]Fuz Ro D-oh
[/url][/size] Copy the [color=#e69138]SKSE[/color] and [color=#e69138]Sound[/color] folders into your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder.

[u][b][color=#f1c232][color=#f1c232][size=6]STEP 3 - THE MOD LIST
[/size][/color][/color][/b][/u][color=#e69138]Now for the easy part! Use Nexus Mod Manager to download and install the mods in the order that they're listed.[/color]

Download, install, and run [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/?]Nexus Mod Manager[/url].  The following mods should be 100% compatible with Nexus Mod Manager (NMM) and can be downloaded by going to the [color=#e69138]Files[/color] section of each mod's page and clicking the green [color=#00ff00]DOWNLOAD WITH MANAGER[/color] button.  Once downloaded, highlight and double-click on a mod to install it.

The mods should be installed in order, from top to bottom, starting with the Unofficial Skyrim Patch and ending with Automatic Variants.  Don't jump around sections, follow the order presented.  The sections aren't definitive labels for groups of mods, as not all texture mods are installed under the textures section to get the desired effect. The sections are more to break up the monotony of installing 200+ mods from a single list.
[b]
[/b][color=#f1c232]When installing, always choose "No" when asked to update. Click "Yes to Mod" when prompted to overwrite.[/color]
[color=#f1c232]
[/color][b]White text is the suggested option.[/b][color=#f1c232]
[/color][b][color=#e69138]Use 1K textures instead of 2K for better performance and stability.[/color]

[color=#e69138][size=4][b]RECOMMENDED FOR BETTER PERFORMANCE AND STABILITY[/b][/size][/color]
Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12801/?]Skyrim Texture Optimizer[/url] (STO).  Download the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36124/?]modified .ini file[/url] and copy it to your STO directory, overwriting the existing file.  Launch [color=#f1c232]Ordenador.exe[/color].  Set [color=#f1c232]Plugins/Data Files[/color] to your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] directory, check all boxes, set [color=#f1c232]Mipmaps[/color] to [color=#f1c232]reburn forced[/color], set [color=#f1c232]Resize down[/color] to [color=#f1c232]If > 4096[/color] and run. When finished set [color=#f1c232]MipMaps [/color]to [color=#f1c232]make if not mipmaps[/color], and run again.  Now the same thing for 2048 - set [color=#f1c232]MipMaps[/color] back to [color=#f1c232]reburn forced [/color]set [color=#f1c232]Resize down[/color] to [color=#f1c232]If >2048 [/color]and run.  Once finsihed, set [color=#f1c232]MipMaps [/color]to [color=#f1c232]make if not mipmaps[/color], and run again.

If you have a high-end computer and prefer quality over performance, you can stop here.  For the majority of computers, repeat the process for [color=#f1c232]Resize down[/color] to[color=#f1c232] If >1024[/color].  For low-end computers, repeat the process for [color=#f1c232]If >1024[/color], and [color=#f1c232]If > 512 [/color]for even better performance.

Optimizing textures can make certain hair/body textures look awful, I recommend re-installing hair/skin textures afterwards (SG Textures/Apachii Hair).


[size=4][color=#ff0000][u][b]IMPORTANT
[/b][/u][/color][/size]If you installed [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11139/?]Empowered Magic[/url] earlier - Open Windows Explorer and navigate to your [color=#f1c232]Skyrim\Data[/color] folder.  Find [color=#f1c232]EmpoweredMagic_Dawnguard.esp[/color] and [color=#f1c232]EmpoweredMagic_Dragonborn.esp[/color], delete them both.  Leave [color=#f1c232]EmpoweredMagic.esp[/color] alone.  The default installation for Empowered Magic automatically installs the Dragonborn and Dawnguard files, which would make Skyrim freak out if you tried to start the game.



[color=#f1c232][size=6][u]STEP 4 - POST NMM-Install[/u][/size][/color][color=#cc0000][size=6]
[/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][size=4][b]1.[/b] [/size][/color][color=#f1c232][b][size=4]Run LOOT
[/size][/b][/color][url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] automatically sorts your mods to the optimal load order, which means you'll never have to manually place a single file in the load order.  Launch [color=#f1c232]LOOT[/color] and click the Sort Plugins button.  Click [color=#f1c232]Apply[/color] on the following window.  

[color=#f1c232][size=4][b]2. [/b][/size][/color][color=#f1c232][size=4][b]Cleaning Mods Using TES5edit[/b][/size]
[/color]The LOOT report will show which mods need cleaning.  This is shown by clicking on the [color=#f1c232]Details[/color] tab of your LOOT report.  All your currently installed mods will be shown, mods that need cleaning will show be highlighted in yellow.  These can be cleaned using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit[/url].

[color=#f1c232]Steps for Cleaning Mods:[/color]
[list=1][*][size=2]Using your LOOT log, find a mod that needs cleaning.  We'll use [color=#f1c232]Update.esm[/color] as an example, as it's the first mod listed that needs cleaning.  [color=#e69138]These steps can be repeated for each mod that contains dirty edits.[/color][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]In your LOOT log, you'll see [color=#f1c232]Update.esm[/color] listed for dirty edits.  ([color=#f1c232]Edit - Older picture using BOSS report instead of LOOT report[/color])[img]http://imgur.com/IlNZI3p.jpg[/img][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Install and run [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5EDIT.exe[/url][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]The opening screen of TES5EDIT is a Master/Plugin Selector list. [color=#f1c232] Right-click and hit "Select None." [/color]None of the boxes should be checked.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Check the box for [color=#f1c232]Update.esm [/color]and hit OK.
[img]http://imgur.com/wGfDOUn.jpg[/img][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Wait for TES5EDIT to load the mod, it'll take a few seconds.  You'll know it's done loading when you see [color=#f1c232]Background Loader: finished [/color]at the bottom of the right pane.  In the left pane, right-click on [color=#f1c232]Update.esm[/color] and choose [color=#f1c232]Apply Filter for Cleaning[/color].
[img]http://imgur.com/vLa5B3i.jpg[/img][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]After a few seconds, the filter should be done.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Right-click on Update.esm again and choose [color=#f1c232]Remove "Identical to Master" records[/color].
[img]http://imgur.com/8c8GXLu.jpg[/img]
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]A warning screen pops up that lets you know you're about to edit a file.  Wait a few seconds, then click [color=#f1c232]Yes I'm Absolutely sure[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]TES5edit will remove your ITM errors.  Onto the UDR's.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Right-click on [color=#f1c232]Update.esm[/color], choose [color=#f1c232]Undelete and Disable References[/color]. (Directly above [i]Remove "Identical to Master"[/i] records)[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]TES5edit will remove your UDR's.  The file has been cleaned.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Exit TES5edit, clicking OK when asked to backup the file you just edited, this saves the changes.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]To double-check the file has been cleaned, run BOSS again.  As you can see, BOSS no longer lists [color=#f1c232]Update.esm[/color] for having dirty edits (although it still lists the Bash Tag suggestion).
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2][color=#f1c232]Repeat these steps for every mod with dirty edits!  [/color][color=#ff0000]!!!CLEAN ONE MOD AT A TIME!!![/color][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Using your BOSS log, find the next mod listed for dirty edits.  If you followed the guide, the next mods to clean would either be [color=#f1c232]LevelersTower.esm[/color] (if you installed it, it was optional) or [color=#f1c232]Cloaks.esp[/color].  Launch TES5edit, right-click to deselect all mods, and check the box for the mod you want to clean.  Apply the cleaning filter, then remove ITM's and UDR's for each mod.  Then exit and save.  [/size][/*]
[*][size=2]There's only a handful of mods that need cleaning, and you're getting close to finishing the guide![/size][/*]
[/list]
[color=#f1c232][size=4][b]3. Run SkyProc Patchers For Automatic Variants and Dual Sheath Redux[/b][/size]
[/color][size=3][b][color=#ff0000]!!![/color][color=#e69138]Requires up-to-date Java[/color][color=#ff0000]!!![/color][/b][/size]
This step uses a patch program which is written in Java.  You'll need the latest [url=http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre7-downloads-1637588.html]Java update[/url] installed for these programs to work.

[list=1][*][size=2]Download and install [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Run LOOT and select [color=#f1c232]Sort Plugins[/color] on the initial menu.  Click [color=#f1c232]Apply[/color] on the following window.  Close the results window.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Download and install [/size][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29865/?]SUM - SkyProc Unified Manager[/url]. (This can be installed with Nexus Mod Manager)[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Using Windows Explorer, navigate to [u][color=#99FFFF]X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim\Data\SkyProc Patchers\SUM[/color][/u][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Run [color=#f1c232]SUM.jar[/color].[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Open the [color=#f1c232]SUM Options[/color] tab, [b][i]uncheck the box for [color=#f1c232]Run BOSS[/color][/i][/b]. [b][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#ff0000](IMPORTANT!)[/color][/b][/size][/*]
[*][size=2][b][color=#e69138][img]http://imgur.com/aE0mPtL.jpg[/img][/color][/b][/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Hit[color=#f1c232] Patch[/color] in the top-right corner.  A patch for Automatic Variants and Dual Sheath Redux will be created automatically.[/size][/*]
[/list]
[size=4][b][color=#f1c232]4. Bash Patch using WryeBash[/color]
[color=#ff7700]**RUN [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/edit/?id=48500]LOOT[/url] BEFORE USING WRyE BASH**[/color]
[/b][/size]Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/?]WryeBash[/url].  Wryebash can be tricky to install, and you may need to install several dependency programs for it to work properly.  Refer to the instructions on the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/?]WryeBash[/url] page for more details.  Once it's correctly installed, launch [color=#f1c232]Wrye Bash.exe[/color]. It should look something like this:
[img]http://imgur.com/vyzJGV4.jpg[/img]
Notice [color=#f1c232]Bashed Patch, 0.esp[/color] is highlighted, we'll be creating a patch with this momentarily.  First, take a second to scroll through your mods.  The vast majority of the mods should be highlighted with a green box and a check mark.  Check marks indicate the mod is active, you can turn mods off by un-checking them.

[color=#ff7700]*UPDATE*[/color]:  Move (click and drag) [color=#f1c232]Mystical Illumination.esp[/color] and place it [b][i]above[/i][/b] [color=#f1c232]ETaC - Complete.esp[/color].  LOOT currently places MI below ETaC, which will create bugs/glitches.

[color=#00ff00]Green boxes[/color] indicate the mod is working properly.
[color=#e69138]Orange boxes[/color] indicate the mod's master files have been re-ordered.
[color=#ff0000]Red boxes[/color] indicate a significant problem with the mod.  Mods with red boxes will likely cause Skyrim to crash when started.  Usually, mods with red boxes are missing prerequisite files such as Dawnguard or Dragonborn.

Right-click on [color=#f1c232]Bashed Patch, 0.esp[/color] and select [color=#f1c232]Rebuild Patch[/color].
[img]http://imgur.com/SxOISzQ.jpg[/img]
You may be prompted to merge patches, de-select any mods listed, and click Skip.

An [color=#f1c232]Update Bashed Patch, 0.esp[/color] window will appear, with various options and settings.  You can click on Tweak Settings to change various options in Skyrim.  I recommend lowering your [color=#f1c232]Timescale[/color] value from the default of 20 to 10 or below.

The main purpose for a Bashed Patch is creating a master [color=#f1c232]Leveled Lists[/color].  Remember the [color=#ff0000]Bash Tag Suggestion(s)[/color] from the BOSS report earlier?  Each of those mods altered Skyrim's loot list in some way.  Without a Bashed Patch, those mods would have to fight over access to the Leveled Lists that control loot.  With a Bashed Patch, all the mods are placed on a Master list preventing conflicts.  WryeBash automatically detects which mods had Bash Tag Suggestion(s) and does its magic.

[img]http://imgur.com/G41WkCK.jpg[/img]
Click [color=#f1c232]Build Patch[/color] at the bottom.  When finished, exit WryeBash.

[color=#f1c232][size=4][b]5. Run GenerateFNISForUsers.exe [/b][/size][/color]
[list=1][*][size=2]Using Windows Explorer, navigate to your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Once in your [color=#e69138]Data[/color] folder, find and open the [color=#e69138]tools[/color] folder, then the [color=#e69138]GenerateFNIS_for_Users[/color] folder.  
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]The resulting directory should be [color=#00ffff](X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim\Data\tools\GenerateFNIS_for_Users)[/color].
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Once there, run [color=#f1c232]GenerateFNISforUsers.exe[/color].
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Check the boxes for "[color=#f1c232]GENDER Specific Animations[/color]" and "[color=#f1c232]SKELETON Arm Fix[/color]" then click the yellow [color=#ffff00]Update FNIS Behavior[/color] button in the middle.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]After a few seconds, it will generate the necessary files and the patch will be finished.[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Click the [color=#f1c232]Exit[/color] button. [/size][/*]
[/list]
[b][color=#f1c232][size=4]6. Run LOOT[/size][/color]
[/b]Sort your plugins one last time.  Check the report for any errors or conflicts.

[color=#f1c232][size=4][b]7. Tweaks[/b][/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][size=2]Depth of Field (DoF) Tweaks:[/size]
[/color]The default for Project ENB is a dynamic DoF that changes fairly often based upon what you're looking at.  A nice feature, but I found it can grow slightly annoying over time.  Thankfully, the author of Project ENB (bronze316) provided some optional DoF's to install on the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20781/?]Project ENB[/url] page under optional files. 
[list=1][*][size=2]Manually download [color=#f1c232]Depth of Field Options UPDATE 4 [/color]from the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20781/?]Project ENB[/url] under optional downloads.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Extract the files.
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Choose a DoF profile (I personally like the [color=#f1c232]Static DoF[/color] option - use this if you're having DoF problems while on horseback)
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Copy the corresponding [color=#f1c232]enbeffectprepass.fx[/color] from the DoF profile to your main [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder (where TESV.exe is located).
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Overwrite the existing file.[/size]
[/*]
[/list]
[color=#f1c232][size=2]Mystical Illumination tweak for ENB:[/size][/color]
Find [color=#f1c232]enbseries.ini[/color] in your main [color=#e69138]Skyrim[/color] folder.

Open [color=#f1c232]enbseries.ini[/color] with Notepad and [color=#f1c232]change the following values for the [/color][color=#c27ba0]pink text[/color]
[quote][WINDOWLIGHT]
IntensitySunrise=2.4
IntensityDay=1.6
Intensity Sunset=2.4
[color=#c27ba0]IntensityNight=1.0[/color]
IntensityInteriorDay=2.4
[color=#c27ba0]IntensityInteriorNight=1.0[/color]
CurveSunrise=1.0
CurveDay=1.0
CurveSunset=1.0
[color=#c27ba0]CurveNight=0.50[/color]
CurveInteriorDay=1.0
[color=#c27ba0]CurveInteriorNight=0.50[/color][/quote][color=#f1c232][b]Defrag the drive Skyrim is installed on.[/b][/color]

[color=#f1c232][size=6]8. [b]Play![/b][/size][/color]
Use [color=#f1c232]SKSE[/color] to launch Skyrim.  Configure/activate mods in-game via the [color=#f1c232]Mod Configuration[/color] menu by pressing Escape.

[color=#f1c232]Known Issues:[/color]
- If you installed ENHANCED MIGHTY DRAGONS with Empowered Magic, the opening Helgen sequence might be a bit rough.  One mod makes Dragons incredibly powerful, the other changes values for damage caused by magic.  The result is fireballs that rain down from the sky and kill you in one hit.  Use console ([color=#f1c232]press the ` key[/color]) to enable immortal mode (type [color=#f1c232]tim[/color] in console) or god-mode (type [color=#f1c232]tgm[/color] in console).
- Skyrim Enhanced Camera might have problems with carriages and may cause some problems during the opening Helgen sequence.
- You can try using the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9557/?]Alternate Start - Live Another Life[/url] mod as a workaround for these issues.  Run LOOT after installing.
